header.title: How to Build OTP like documentation

section.title: Create XML files from code
section.p: If there are EDoc comments in a module, the escript xml_from_edoc.escript can be used to generate an XML file according to the erlref DTD for this module.

section.title: Include code in XML
section.p: If there are OTP DTD codeinclude tags in the source XML file, the escript codeline_preprocessing.escript can be used to include the code and produce an XML file according to the OTP DTDs.

section.title: Use xsltproc to generate different output formats
Parameters used in all the the XSL transformations
section.p: These parameters to xsltproc are used for all the supported output formats.

taglist.item: The date string that will be used in the documentation.

section.title: Generate HTML output
section.p: When generating HTML one also needs these three pramaters to xsltproc.

taglist.item: Output directory for the produced html files.
If one builds a standalone documentation for an application this should be set to ".".
Relative path from the html directory to where the pdf file are placed.

section.code: 1> xsltproc --noout --stringparam outdir /tmp/myhtmldoc \ --stringparam docgen $(ERL_TOP)/lib/erl_docgen \ --stringparam topdocdir . \ --stringparam pdfdir "$(PDFDIR)" \ --xinclude \ --stringparam gendate "December 5 2011" \ --stringparam appname MyApp \ --stringparam appver 0.1 \ -path $ERL_TOP/lib/erl_docgen/priv/dtd \ -path $ERL_TOP/lib/erl_docgen/priv/dtd_html_entities \ $ERL_TOP/lib/erl_docgen/priv/xsl/db_html.xsl mybook.xml

section.title: Generate PDF
section.p: The generation of the PDF file is done in two steps. First is xsltproc used to generate a .fo file which is used as input to the fop command to produce th PDF file.
section.code:
1> xsltproc --output MyApp.fo \ --stringparam docgen $ERL_TOP/lib/erl_docgen \ --stringparam gendate "December 5 2011" \ --stringparam appname MyApp \ --stringparam appver 0.1 \ --xinclude \ -path $ERL_TOP/lib/erl_docgen/priv/dtd \ -path $ERL_TOP/lib/erl_docgen/priv/dtd_html_entities \ $ERL_TOP/lib/erl_docgen/priv/xsl/db_pdf.xsl mybook.xml
2> fop -fo MyApp.fo -pdf MyApp.pdf

section.title: Generate man pages
section.p: Unix man pages can be generated with xsltproc from XML files written according to the different OTP ref type DTDs.
section.code: 1> xsltproc --output my_module.3\ --stringparam docgen $ERL_TOP/lib/erl_docgen \ --stringparam gendate "December 5 2011" \ --stringparam appname MyApp \ --stringparam appver 0.1 \ --xinclude -path $ERL_TOP/lib/erl_docgen/priv/dtd \ -path $ERL_TOP/lib/erl_docgen/priv/dtd_man_entities \ $ERL_TOP/lib/erl_docgen/priv/xsl/db_man.xsl my_refpage.xml

section.title: Upcoming changes
section.p: The output from the erl_docgen documentation build process is now just the OTP style. But in a near future we will for example add the possibility to change logo, color in the PDF and style sheet for the HTML.
